sub_title: HR Generalist who is passionate about creating work environments that help get the best out of people.
summary:
I’m an HR Generalist who is passionate about improving employee relations and creating work environments that help get the best out of people to deliver great outcomes.

I’ve recently relocated to Amsterdam. Previously I was HR Manager at Options for Supported Living.

A member of the Senior Leadership Team I was involved in strategic decision making and planning for the organisation and HR function, being a major contributor to the organisations ongoing development plan; embedding Options culture and helping shape the focus and direction of the organisation. I was also very hands-on operationally; not being afraid to get stuck in and work alongside my team of 4 direct reports or delegate when appropriate.

Over the years I’ve received several awards for business and customer service excellence including a prestigious ‘people's choice’ award for special contribution, and recently in recognition of my positive impact at Options and support of staff.

My sales and marketing background has honed my ability to positively influence others, build relationships quickly and understand that people want to be listened to and know their opinion matters.

I believe mistakes are only mistakes if you don’t learn from them and if you focus your efforts on developing and supporting staff to be the best they can be everything else falls into place. Using this philosophy, I recruited, trained, and developed an exceptional HR team; significantly improving HR outputs, resolving previous employee and management issues and establishing a credible and employee-centric focused HR department.

Outside of work, I love reading, with a focus on Personal Development, and learning new skills. I've taught myself to sew, knit, and crochet and have attended evening courses to perfect my dressmaking and pattern cutting skills. I’m currently learning Dutch.

I’m looking for a new HR opportunity in Amsterdam so please get in touch if you feel I'd be a good fit (heidimclean_cv@hotmail.co.uk).

volunteer_experiences.description: So far I've helped cook burgers and play bingo with the homeless; an extremely rewarding and enjoyable day where I got to meet some fantastic people.

A fantastic community event organised by Wirral Mencap, Options for Supported Living and Wirral Evolutions that promoted inclusion, diversity, and community connectedness, and highlighted the achievements and positive contributions made to society by local people with a learning disability.

I assisted with a variety of tasks throughout the day including: directing traffic, handing out flyers, supporting the dance, and drumming workshop leaders; ensuring the tent did not become overcrowded, helping vendors set up stalls, ensuring appropriate waste receptacles were arranged around the site and anything else the co-ordinators of the day needed me to do to ensure the event ran smoothly.
